metadata.Title: CVE-2017-14733 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
ReadRLEImage in coders/rle.c in GraphicsMagick 1.3.26 mishandles RLE headers that specify too few colors, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (heap-based buffer over-read and application crash) via a crafted file.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-14733` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

graphicsmagick - 1.3.23-1ubuntu0.4
graphicsmagick-imagemagick-compat - 1.3.23-1ubuntu0.4
libgraphics-magick-perl - 1.3.23-1ubuntu0.4
libgraphicsmagick++-q16-12 - 1.3.23-1ubuntu0.4
libgraphicsmagick-q16-3 - 1.3.23-1ubuntu0.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: graphicsmagick package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.3.23-1ubuntu0.4').
